title: Bordeaux wine
summary: Bordeaux wine (Occitan: vin de Bord√®u, French: vin de Bordeaux) is produced in the Bordeaux region of southwest France, around the city of Bordeaux, on the Garonne River. To the north of the city the Dordogne River joins the Garonne forming the broad estuary called the Gironde; the Gironde department, with a total vineyard area of over 120,000 hectares,[1] is the largest wine growing area in France.
